intro: Aeschynanthus foxworthyi, commonly known as the foxworthys' jewel, is a species of flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical forests. It produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
